intro: Palicourea soejartoi, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and grows as a leafy shrub or vine. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Palicourea soejartoi is notable for its ability to parasitize a variety of host trees, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
